title: Book/Print, "Design for a table with monopods, Plate 38 in Receuil des dècorations intérieurs", 1812
inscribed:
lower left under image: Ch. Percier et Fontaine
below image at center, titles for the four separate objects depicted. Titles arranged in double columns: 
No.1. Bureau éxécuté à Paris pour Mr. V.
No.2. Vase execute en Bronse  pour Mr. V. / 
No.3. Face laterale du Bureau No.1
No.4. Pendule qui doit porter un Buste
upper right corner: Pl. 38
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Plate 38 shows four separate images each numbered 1 to 4. Number 1, shown at the top of the sheet is a design for a heavy table with monopod motifs at either end. Number 2, at center, is a design for a bronze vase. Number 3, lower left, depicts the side panel of the desk shown at top that features a figure of Fame with attributes of laurel wreath and trumpet standing on a ledge above a bucranium. Number 4, lower right, shows a clock design featuring Apollo in his chariot above the dial and a frieze of dancing nymphs in classical garb on either side of a Janus headed herm below.

tombstone.epitaph:
Book/Print, "Design for a table with monopods, Plate 38 in Receuil des dècorations intérieurs", 1812.
1812. Etching on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-377-39.
